page.title: 09ST. MARTIN'S IN 1985 (1)
page.content:
I was brought up in the primarily agricultural parish of St. Martin. Memories of this beautiful north-east corner of the Island in the late 1950s and early 1960s are still vivid, with its compact farms and narrow leafy lanes.
It is quite remarkable, when one looks at the Island generally, that the Parish of St. Martin bears fewer scars of the 1970s and '80s than most of the other parishes in Jersey. Whilst working on the Domesday Project I have had the opportunity to retrace the steps of my childhood, and note some of the changes that have taken place.
